snippet: So far, the Obama administration is bungling its mission for fighting the Islamic State in Syria.
abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column holds Pres Obama's rollout of military campaign in Syria feels chaotic and poorly informed; contends root of problem is that alarm and revulsion at beheadings by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria has led to rush to intervene and take center role in conflict; says American involvement should be conducted cautiously and in partnership with Sunni allies; warns America must not become so obsessed with ISIS that it forgets other problems at home and abroad.
lead_paragraph: So far, the Obama administration is bungling its mission for fighting the Islamic State in Syria.

headline.seo: The ISIS Campaign Is Off to a Shaky Start
headline.main: From D.C. to Syria, a Mess
headline.print_headline: From D.C. to Syria, a Mess
